sentences.english: In these cases, the best got the message to end the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 遇到这些情况，最好知趣地结束谈话。

sentences.english: The ship's orchestra's conductor stood to one side, looking peeved but apprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 舰队的管弦乐团指挥站在一边，面色虽愠怒但很知趣。
友情是知趣相投的共享。

sentences.english: What can he mean by being so tiresome as to be always coming here?
sentences.chinese: 他为什么那样不知趣，老是要上这儿来？

sentences.english: I was Very discreet and didn't disturb you, just to see when you'd speak to me.
sentences.chinese: 我知趣得很，决不打搅你，看你什么时候跟我说话。

sentences.english: We both thought that he would take the hint and get lost, but he didn't.
sentences.chinese: 我们想这样她应该知趣地走开了，但他没有。

sentences.english: There had been no ring, which was discreet on such a day.
sentences.chinese: 没有按门铃，在当天这样做是知趣的。

sentences.english: After Lu Heyong see very discretion in avoidance.
sentences.chinese: 卢鹤永看到后很知趣的回避了。

sentences.english: When the boss comes, she knows her place.
sentences.chinese: 老板一来，她立刻变得知趣多了。

definition: to invite a snub/to court a rebuff
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
talkative/to speak out of turn/to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/rumors fly
to show deference or praise publicly

combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书[liu4 shu1] of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds/to comprehend without being told explicitly/to cotton on/knowing (smile, glance etc)
